sense.name: a physical building, place or artifact that serves some purpose
sense.commentary: FACILITY[+physical][+site][+building/+area/+artifact] Note: the physical facet of sense 2
sense.examples: The Allies bombed many manufacturing facilities in Germany during WWII. The facilities for both men and women are located behind the bar. (euphemism: toilets) This state park has three facilities for picnicking. How does this facility work? That tall granite building is the new medical facility.

sense.name: the role of being a provider of a resource, service or amenity
sense.commentary: FACILITY[+role][+provider][+resource/+service/+amenity] Note: the functional or purposive facet of sense 1
sense.examples: Does the suite include kitchen facilities? As a preferred customer you will have free access to all the hotel's facilities. Many developing nations have limited educational facilities for their children,. Free childcare and a spa are just two of the many facilities available at the new resort.

sense.name: skillfulness, adeptness
sense.examples: She has a facility for remembering faces. They spoke French with great facility. John displays a natural facility for cooking.

sense.name: a useful feature of something
sense.examples: Does your cell phone have an Internet facility? This software application doesn't seem to have a help facility.
